details.publicNotes: Roaming in the Ever Freeze forest, Ice Hearts have no relation to the phoenix wolves, though both clearly appear to have canine origins. Free of hellish taint, Ice Hearts find simple pleasure in bringing frozen pain to those they find, especially those that visibly dislike it.

description.value: Though not especially bound by laws or words, if one finds the true name of an Ice Heart or otherwise impress on it the need, they can extract one specific demand. Once that wish is fulfilled, the Ice Heart is free to do as it wishes, including revenge. Some keep the terms vague for this reason.

The area within 30 feet of the Ice Heart decreases in temperature by one degree to at least mild cold, then the damage is dealt in accordance to the new level. For a minute, the cold remains. The same Ice Heart cannot increase the cold, but can reset the duration and force those in it to take the damage again.
If they flank an enemy when Striking, the Ice Heart deals 1d6 extra precision damage. On a critical hit, they render the enemy off-guard.

Requirements A living target that is prone or helpless adjacent to the Ice Heart

The Ice Heart attempts to draw the warmth from them. They must make a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature becomes or increases their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} to a maximum of 4 for up to an hour.

Critical Failure As a failure, but the creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for a round.

Requirements It is already snowing

The Ice Heart can unleash sudden snow balls at enemies. This is as per jaws attack but deals bludgeoning damage instead of piercing and has a range of 60 feet.
